intro: Fumaria agraria, commonly known as the field pennycress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer, often in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a distinctive appearance. Fumaria agraria is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in agricultural fields.
